DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Actual Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A judgment of the final state of a person who experienced an adverse event, which takes place after the adverse event occurs. The date and time span when this activity began and ended. EXAMPLE(S): The date and time when a sample is taken from the subject. A dose of chemotherapy is given on June 12th starting at 9am and finishing at 12pm.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Actual Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Existing in fact; real.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Existing in fact; real.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
